connector.description: Receive messages from a Slack channel.

camel.kamelet.slack-source.serverUrl.name: camel.kamelet.slack-source.serverUrl
camel.kamelet.slack-source.serverUrl.description: The Slack API server endpoint URL. Example: https://slack.com

camel.kamelet.slack-source.channel.name: camel.kamelet.slack-source.channel
camel.kamelet.slack-source.channel.description: The Slack channel to receive messages from. Example: #myroom

camel.kamelet.slack-source.token.name: camel.kamelet.slack-source.token
camel.kamelet.slack-source.token.description: The Bot User OAuth Access Token to access Slack. A Slack app that has the following permissions is required: `channels:history`, `groups:history`, `im:history`, `mpim:history`, `channels:read`, `groups:read`, `im:read`, and `mpim:read`.

camel.kamelet.slack-source.delay.name: camel.kamelet.slack-source.delay
camel.kamelet.slack-source.delay.description: The delay between polls. If no unit provided, milliseconds is the default. Example: 60s or 6000 or 1m

camel.kamelet.slack-source.naturalOrder.name: camel.kamelet.slack-source.naturalOrder
camel.kamelet.slack-source.naturalOrder.description: Create exchanges in natural order (oldest to newest) or not.
